Q: Gifts and sacrifices are offered that deal only with what?
A: Food and drink and various washings, regulations for the body imposed until the time of reformation. (Heb 9:10)

Q: God also bore witness by what?
A: Signs and wonders and various miracles and by gifts of the Holy Spirit (distributed according to his will). (Heb 2:4)

Q: He has caused us to be born again to an inheritance that is what?
A: Imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven for you. (1Pe 1:4)

Q: Let none of you suffer as a what?
A: As a murderer or a thief or an evildoer or as a meddler. (1Pe 4:15)
With a true heart in full assurance of faith, with our hearts sprinkled clean from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water. (Heb 10:22)
Mocking and flogging, and even chains and     imprisonment. (Heb 11:36)

Q: The God of all grace will himself what?
A: Restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish you. (1Pe 5:10)

Q: The word of God is piercing to the division of what?
A: Of soul and of spirit, of joints and of marrow. (Heb 4:12)

Q: They went about, wandering about where?
A: In deserts and mountains, and in dens and caves of the earth. (Heb 11:38)

Q: What are offered according to the law?
A: (These) Sacrifices and offerings and burnt offerings and sin offerings. (Heb 10:8) (cf Heb 8:4)

Q: You are a what, that you may proclaim the excellencies of him who called you?
A: A chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession. (1Pe 2:9)

Q: You have neither desired nor taken pleasure in what?
A: Sacrifices and offerings and burnt offerings and sin offerings. (Heb 10:8) (cf Heb 10:6)
